intro: Crotalaria lusingaensis, commonly known as the Lusinga crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. It grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and savannas. Crotalaria lusingaensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
